long_desc.thetext: This bug groups issues and efforts concerning the testing of a qooxdoo release - of course before it is released :).

Release testing can be split up into two major activities: 1. Browser testing 2. Build testing
1. Browser testing Browser testing is concerned with the question if the various applications of the release run correctly in all supported browsers. - To that end, the release will be installed under a commonly accessible web server (e.g. on the test pc, pcthron7, or similar). - The SDK will be unpacked on the common web server machine, and the necessary targets will be built. - The common web server will offer both source and build versions of the applications; if deemed helpful, it can also offer api and test versions of the applications. - All supported browsers from all supported platforms will be run against this central web server (as explicated in a test plan, see #1347).
2. Build testing Build testing is concerned with running the tool chain of the release on all supported platforms (Linux, MacOSX, Windows,...). - Various team members download the release kit to one of the platforms, unpack it, and run necessary jobs against the kit (as explicated in a test plan, see #1347). - The results of the build jobs are tested locally with an available browser.
The aggravation of this partitioning of test activities would be to build the application targets on *all* platforms, expose each through a web server, and then test from *all* browsers against *all* of these builds. But this seems not feasible currently.
The aim of all of these tests is to produce fail/pass test reports, not to start fixing immediately. After the test round has been completed, all found issues are discussed in a status meeting, and then e.g. a fixing round is started, followed by another test round.
